traits.criteria_for_selection: Proposed as a candidate to replace Judas among the Twelve, having accompanied the disciples from the baptism of John to the ascension and thus able to serve as a witness to the resurrection.
traits.casting_lots: Chosen by lot after prayer that the Lord would show which candidate he has chosen, underscoring divine guidance in restoring the apostolic circle.
traits.role_as_witness: Though no further stories about him are narrated, he is counted with the eleven apostles, symbolically restoring the number of Israel’s tribes in the new movement.
traits.narrative_silence: Acts’s silence beyond his selection has encouraged later traditions to speculate about his subsequent ministry, but the canonical text keeps the focus on his representative function.
